name: Dog Sports Trivia Game | Dogs | 20 Questions

questions.text: In this sport, teams of 4 dogs race, one at a time, over a series of 4 jumps to catch a ball that is thrown from a box when the dog strikes the box with its paws.
questions.explanation:
Flyball.

	Want to see my flyball team? Check out www.flyball.com, click on 'Flyball.com roster', and click on 'Fast Fourward'.

questions.text: In this sport, the handler guides the dog over and through a maze of obstacles such as jumps, tunnels, weave poles, A-frame, teeter and dogwalk.
questions.explanation:
Agility.

	It's probably the fastest-growing dog sport.

questions.text: This sport is for protection dogs. It tests the dog's skills in obedience, tracking, and personal protection.
questions.explanation:
Schutzhund.

	It was invented to test the breedworthiness of the German Shepherd.

questions.text: In this winter sport, a dog helps pull the handler, who rides on skis.
questions.explanation:
Skijoring.

	It sounds rather dangerous, but it is supposed to be great fun!

questions.text: The sport in which dogs are judged on how well they meet a written standard of appearance. Championship titles are awarded.
questions.explanation:
Conformation.

	'Dog show' is a general term for all the events that can happen in one place. 'Confirmation' is what you do in church! It's a common error.

questions.text: In this sport, sighthounds chase a plastic bag attached to a system of wires that pulls it over the ground at high speeds, simulating the twisting and dodging of a hare.
questions.explanation:
Lure Coursing.

	Many breeds that are not sighthounds also enjoy lure coursing.

questions.text: This sport tests how well a dog can follow verbal commands and hand signals.
questions.explanation:
Obedience.

	It's one of the oldest dog sports- obedience trials in the US first became popular in the 1950s.

questions.text: In this dog sport, terriers follow the scent of rats through a simulated underground warren, to find and bark at the cage containing the rats.
questions.explanation:
Earthdog Trials.

	The rats are not harmed.

questions.text: In this sport, packs of hounds follow an artificial scent trail that has been laid for them, rather than chasing a live animal. They are often followed by people on horseback.
questions.explanation:
Drag Hunting.

	No animals are harmed in this sport.

questions.text: Which of the following sports would be most likely to attract Afghan Hounds, Whippets and Borzoi?
questions.explanation:
Lure Coursing.

	Sighthounds are bred to course!

questions.text: Which of the following sports would be most likely to be attended by Labrador Retrievers and Golden Retrievers?
questions.explanation:
Retriever Field Trials.

	Labs take home most of the prizes.

questions.text: Which sport would be the favorite of Cardigan Welsh Corgis and Pulis?
questions.explanation:
Herding.

	They are herding breeds.

questions.text: You see a dog with the title 'CD' after his name. What do those letters stand for?
questions.explanation:
Companion Dog.

	It's the lowest level of AKC obedience.

questions.text: Which is the highest level of regular obedience classes at AKC obedience trials?
questions.explanation:
Utility.

	In Utility, dogs perform difficult tasks like a directed retrieve, directed jumping, and scent discrimination.

questions.text: In which obedience class do two dogs compete as a team?
questions.explanation:
Brace.

	This can be hilarious- or inspirational, depending on the dogs' behavior!

questions.text: In which sport do dogs follow a scent trail left by a person?
questions.explanation:
Tracking.

	AKC awards several types of tracking titles.

questions.text: In what sport do dogs jump over a series of jumps and sort through a pile of dumbbells to find the one that has their owner's scent?
questions.explanation:
Scent Hurdles.

	Scent hurdles has pretty much been eclipsed by flyball- I don't know if anyone participates in this any more.

questions.text: You see a dog with the title 'Ch' in front of his name. What does this title indicate?
questions.explanation:
Champion.

	This title is earned at conformation shows.

questions.text: A neutered dog cannot be shown in AKC obedience trials.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Neutered dogs cannot be shown in conformation. They can compete in all other sports.

questions.text: Mixed-breed dogs cannot be shown in AKC obedience trials.
questions.explanation:
False.

	This was true for many, many years but, as of 2010, AKC now has a titling program for mixes.
